mnemonic: ESTAR = 'stay' for temporary STATES - E-STAR (star that moves!)
grammar_notes: ESTAR is for temporary states: location mood health conditions. Use SER for permanent traits.
cultural_note: The ser/estar distinction is crucial in Portuguese - natives immediately notice mistakes!
tip: Use for temporary states - location feelings health

mnemonic: EU ESTOU - 'I stay' in this STATE right now
grammar_notes: First person singular of estar. Use for how you feel NOW not your personality.
cultural_note: 'Estou bem' is the standard response to 'Como está?' - automatic in conversation.
tip: Temporary states - how you feel where you are

mnemonic: TU ESTÁS - the final S = informal (TU has an S in it!)
grammar_notes: Second person informal (tu). The 's' ending marks tu conjugations.
cultural_note: In Porto people use 'tu' more than Lisbon. Know both forms!

mnemonic: VOCÊ ESTÁ - same as ELE/ELA form - VOCÊ is formal YOU
grammar_notes: Formal 'you'. Same conjugation as ele/ela. Safer in new situations.
cultural_note: In business always use 'você está' until invited to use 'tu'.

mnemonic: ELE ESTÁ - HE is in this STATE (temporary)
grammar_notes: Third person masculine singular. Same form as você/ela está.
cultural_note: 'Ele não está' (he's not in) is what you'll hear when someone is unavailable.

mnemonic: ELA ESTÁ - SHE is in this STATE (temporary)
grammar_notes: Third person feminine singular. Same form as você/ele está.
cultural_note: 'Ela está bem' can be a reassurance that someone is okay.

mnemonic: NÓS ESTAMOS - 'WE stay' together in this STATE
grammar_notes: First person plural. The -mos ending marks 'we' in all verbs.
cultural_note: Portuguese families often say 'estamos bem' to describe the whole family's wellbeing.

mnemonic: ELES ESTÃO - the nasal ÃO ending for THEY
grammar_notes: Third person plural. The 'ão' is a nasal sound unique to Portuguese.
cultural_note: 'Estão' rhymes with words like 'pão' (bread) - practice the nasal!

mnemonic: ONDE ESTÁ = WHERE is it STAYING - for locations!
grammar_notes: Question word + estar. Always use estar for asking locations.
cultural_note: Essential tourist phrase! 'Onde está a casa de banho?' (Where is the bathroom?)

mnemonic: COMO ESTÁ = HOW are you STAYING (in what state?)
grammar_notes: Formal greeting. Uses estar because wellbeing is temporary.
cultural_note: Always reply 'Bem obrigado/a e você?' - shows good manners!
